article_text:
This image is a screen capture grabbed just before sunries today from the S.C. Department of Transportation’s traffic camera on the Arthur Ravenel Jr. Bridge.

Today we’ll see plentiful sunshine with highs in the mid 50s, according to the forecast from the National Weather Service. Winds will be light and variable. There is no rain in the forecast.

Tonight will be clear with lows in the high 30s and winds light and variable.

Sunday will be sunny, along with a few afternoon clouds. Highs will be in the low 60s, with winds from the northeast at 5 to 10 mph.

Sunday evening will be partly cloudy, then becoming cloudy overnight. Lows will be in the high 40s with winds light and variable.

There is no rain in the forecast until Monday when there is a 10 percent chance of rain.

EDITOR’S NOTE: An earlier version of this story had an incorrect high temperature range for Saturday.

For up-to-the minute weather information, including extended forecasts and interactive radar, go to postandcourier.com/weather.
